title: Excluded Websites Blocklist — Prevent AI Access to Financial Institutions
Secure API key generation on first run
New browser tabs open in unnamed/uncolored tab group instead of blue WebPilot group
description: When opening a new browser tab via the WebPilot MCP server (browser_create_tab), the tab is placed in an unnamed and uncolored tab group. Previously, tabs were placed in a blue-colored group named 'WebPilot'. This is a regression — the tab group naming and coloring needs to be restored.

comments.author: Jacob Tonna
comments.text: Approved plan: [Sub-task 1] Add await to addTabToGroup() at 3 call sites in handlers/tabs.js (~lines 162, 175, 185). Complexity: light. [Sub-task 2] Manual verification across all 3 code paths. Complexity: light. Depends on sub-task 1.

comments.author: Jacob Tonna
comments.text: Investigation complete. The await fix (commit 0302d41) is correct and resolves the race condition in our code. The remaining visual issue — tab group title/color not rendering until user interaction — is a confirmed Chrome 145 rendering bug. The API succeeds (verified via chrome.tabGroups.get() returning correct title and color), but Chrome does not repaint the tab group UI. This is fixed in Chrome 146. No further code changes needed on our side.

title: Restricted mode: domain whitelist with default-block-all
description: EMERGENCY SECURITY FEATURE. Add a restricted mode toggle (ON by default) that blocks ALL WebPilot MCP commands on any site not in a user-managed whitelist. Scope: (1) Extension-level block — any MCP command involving a tab is rejected if the tab domain is not whitelisted. (2) Rejection message returned to AI agent: 'Blocked: [domain] is not whitelisted. The human must manually add this site to the whitelist in the WebPilot extension before automation can proceed.' (3) Domain-level granularity — e.g. yahoo.com covers all subdomains and paths. (4) UI in extension popup: restricted mode ON/OFF toggle, button to whitelist/remove current site, editable list of all whitelisted domains. (5) Storage in chrome.storage.local. (6) Default state: ON — all sites blocked until manually whitelisted. (7) Independent of blocklist ticket WebPilot-03d — both coexist.

comments.author: Jacob Tonna

[Sub-task 2] STANDARD — Add popup UI: restricted mode toggle (default ON), one-click whitelist/remove current site button, domain input + add button, editable domain list with remove buttons. Normalize input. [Sub-task 3] LIGHT — Copy modified files to electron/dist and dist directories. Depends on 1+2.

title: Implement onboarding wizard in Electron app
WebPilot window mode creates small window — should remember last size/position
description: When tabMode is set to window, chrome.windows.create() in createTab() does not pass width/height/top/left parameters, so Chrome uses a small default window size. Resizing the window has no effect — next time a new WebPilot window is created it reverts to the small default. Fix: persist the window bounds (width, height, top, left) to chrome.storage.local whenever the user resizes/moves the WebPilot window, and restore those bounds when creating a new window.

comments.author: Jacob Tonna
comments.text: Approved plan: [Sub-task 1] STANDARD — Add chrome.windows.onBoundsChanged listener in background.js to save WebPilot window bounds to chrome.storage.local. Modify createTab() in tabs.js to load saved bounds and pass to chrome.windows.create(). Add windows permission to manifest.json. [Sub-task 2] LIGHT — Sync dist copies. Run docs scout.
